The theme was super hero’s so after some searching he found what he thought was a Spider-Man outfit, a fitted all in one with a face mask. It covered him from head to toe.

Arriving at the hotel he checked into his room, after an initial mixup he got the correct room and he got ready for the party. Joining his friends at the bar for pre-party drinks.

“Hey, looks it’s spider woman” danny said

“No, its Spider-Man” Marshall said

“No, i am pretty sure that’s a spider woman costume” Danny grinned

“It’s not” Marshall replied “are we drinking or what”

“Come on boys” Marshall said and they were soon in their third pint.

Katy walked across the bar to join them “hey boys, starting earlier”

Marshall turned around, and his heart sank. Katy was wearing a spider woman costume. It was identical except she was wearing a pair of red stiletto knee high boots with hers, compared to his trainers hidden under the costumes feet.

Walking through to the party they were all soon feeling very drunk. Marshall spotted Katy sitting down so he joined her.

Marshall removed the rest of Becky costume until she was naked on the bed. Her black leather cat suit, lay in a pile along with her underwear and ankle boots.

Marshall grinned, why not. He was soon dressed in the costume. It was extremely tight figure hugging and he needed to push his tackle between his legs held in by the thong so it wouldn’t show, stuffing his feet into the high heeled boots he stood up and put on the mask. Applying the red lipstick from Becky bag he was now her twin.

142.content: How does Ted Smith end up swapping clothes with someone
142.title: Ted smith

choices: Someone walks in on them first
1421.content:
Ted and his assistant Lindsey had stayed at the office all night so she could help him finish a project for an important meeting the next day. But one thing led to another, as it usually did, and at 6:15 the next morning, they were curled up on the couch in Ted's office, naked, sweaty, still high on the endorphins from their latest round of lovemaking. As far as they knew, they were the only ones in the building.

Lindsey stretched and ran her fingers through her dark brown hair, which she wore in short, extremely chic style. (Ted's, on the other hand, was long for a man, though he usually wore it slicked back at work to fit the conservative dress code.)

"I'm starving," she said. "Want something from the vending machine?"

"Anything with chocolate," he replied, still slightly dazed.

She slipped on his expensive powder blue dress shirt, then looked around the floor before stepping into his black leather oxford shoes. "Hey, that's my stuff!" he protested. She grinned and said, "It is way too early to be walking in heels, boss man," and marched out towards the break room.

Ted sat up, drank from a bottle of water on the end table, and tried to remind himself of the day's schedule. Lindsey returned with a couple of Snickers bars. She looked deep in thought.

"What's up?" Ted asked her.

"I was just surprised by how well these shoes and this shirt fit me," she said, walking around and turning to show off how comfortably she could move in them. "I knew we were about the same height, but still. You would think these were mine to begin with."

"My mother used to say we were lucky that my feet stopped growing before the rest of me did, so we wouldn't have to keep buying new shoes," he replied.

She looked down at her feet, then at his, and a wicked grin spread across her face. Ted knew that look meant nothing good for him, but couldn't resist asking, "What?"

She grabbed her black Louboutins off the floor and sat next to him. "Well, it occurs to me that if your shoes fit me so perfectly, then mine should do the same for you." She sat down and placed the high-heeled pumps on the floor in front of him. "What say we prove my hypothesis?"

"You want me to wear your shoes?" he asked, laughing nervously? "Didn't you just say it's too early for heels?"

"Too early for me to wear them after having spent all of yesterday in those pretty but uncomfortable things," she said, stroking his leg in a way that made him feel weak. "You, on the other hand, have just been cruising around in these low to the ground wonders, so I think your feet can take the Lobu's better than mine at the moment."

"I'm not going to wear your shoes!" he protested. "That's ridiculous. What if anybody sees me?"

Her fingers now moved to his inner thigh as she said, "The custodial staff doesn't even get here until 7:30. We are all alone. This is a safe space, and I want to see how sexy your legs and ass look in these. Won't you do it for me? Please?"

Between the pouty, sexy look on her face and the feel of her hand hovering near his groin, Ted felt powerless to resist. He let Lindsey squeeze his feet into the narrow shoes, then help him stand up. He wobbled a bit at first, then found his balance. He and Lindsey were the same height in bare feet, so he towered over her the way she usually did in heels.

She stepped back to study him, circling his body and whistling approvingly. "My goodness, you've got some nice legs, boss man," she said with a giggle. "How do they feel?"

"Better than I would have thought," he admitted. "They're a little pinchy, but they fit."

She encouraged him to walk around his office in them. After a few stumbles, he gained his balance and was practically gliding in them. "Goddamn!" Lindsey cheered. "Do you want some fries with that shake?"

"Satisfied?" he asked, trying to keep from blushing. He felt a bit embarrassed, but there was something else there — a feeling he was too afraid to fully recognize.

"I don't know," she said smugly. "If our shoes fit each other so well, maybe we should see how the rest of the ensembles look."

"What do you mean?" he asked, both nervous and excited.

She gestured to his expensive navy pinstripe three-piece suit, which was lying across his desk, and then to her sleeveless red silk blouse and black pencil skirt, and said, "I want to try on that fabulous suit of yours, and I want to see how you look in my clothes."

Ted's heart was pounding his chest. He was both terrified of the idea itself and at how excited he realized it made him. He wasn't sure what to do next.

"Oh god, someone's here!" Ted whispered. "What do we do?"

"Hide?" Lindsey suggested, but before they could even move, they heard the familiar click of high-heeled shoes against the tile floor growing louder and louder.

"Whoever it is is coming this way!" Ted said, realizing his office was the only room on the floor with the lights on. He looked down at himself in women's clothing and moaned, "Oh, why did I agree to this?"

"Relax, Ted!" Lindsey barked, straightening her tie. "Hopefully, this just becomes an amusing anecdote people tell about you when you're running this place one day."

The footsteps grew ever closer, and suddenly there was a striking middle-aged redhead standing in the doorway. Ted's heart sank even further. Though he had never met this woman, he recognized her as the company's new CEO, Jessica Flynn. She looked at them, curious.

"And who might you two be?" she asked.

Ted walked back over to Lindsey's desk. What was he going to do, Lindsey had no spare shoes at her desk. Sitting down he pushed his feet into the boots zipping them up. They were at least lower than the heels but he hated how tight they were on his legs.

Walking to the lifts he slipped on Lindeys overcoat and put her handbag on his shoulder as the lift doors closed he could see Jessica and Lindsey deep in conversation in his office. How did this go so wrong?

Walking across the reception area and into the street, he walked into the shoe repairers, after handing over the boots they were quickly repaired and back on his feet. He then grabbed the coffee and went back to the office. Flashing Lindseys security badge he was soon in the lifts.

As the door opened the office was starting to fill up. As Ted walked across the floor he hoped no one would notice. He and Lindsey were new to the floor so he felt slightly easier.

Hanging up Lindsey's overcoat and putting her handbag under her desk he removed the boots and carried them along with the coffee back to his office, knocking on the door her walked in.

"Good," Jessica said taking the coffee

"I have your repaired boots here" Ted replied

"Well, it's so hot in here I have decided to wear your heels, you can wear my boots, that will be all"Jessica said

Ted looked at Lindsey who had taken his suit jacket off and was sat confidently at his desk.

"Okay," Ted said returning to Lindsey's desk. Sitting down he put the boots back on zipping them up.
14211311.title: Jessica believes they are each other

142113111.content:
Lindsey reflexively straightened her tie again as Jessica paced around Ted's office. She had played along with his decision for them to pretend to be each other, simply because she wasn't sure what else to do in that moment. But now Jessica thought she was Ted, and vice versa. And worse, the rest of the staff had started to file in. Even though they were new to this floor, the odds of making it through an entire work day without running into someone who knew who she really was seemed impossible. And even if they somehow did, she realized, it wasn't like Jessica was going anywhere. She was in charge of the whole company! And Ted was one of the company's most promising young executives. It wasn't like they could avoid her after today. If it wouldn't ruin the masculine persona she was trying so desperately to maintain, Lindsey would have cried (or, at least, pouted).

Something in her pocket buzzed, and she realized she had Ted's phone. She fished it out of her trousers and saw a calendar reminder (one that she had made, in her real job as Ted's assistant) for the big meeting they had stayed up late the night before to prep.

Jessica, who had been droning on about her management style, noticed her looking at the phone. "Something the matter, Ted?"

Lindsey wasn't sure of the right thing to do, or say, under these crazy circumstances, but she had to make a decision. It was a meeting with a company called Bannister, and Ted had to this point communicated with them only by phone and email, so they wouldn't necessarily know what he looked like. Plus, the thing was supposed to happen at the hotel where Bannister's rep was staying, which would get her out of the office for a bit and at least delay the moment of discovery by a few hours.

"I'm supposed to go to Bannister to make the pitch," she said, trying to sound confident. "Lindsey should have CC'ed you on the details yesterday. I really want to spend as much time with you as I can, but I really should be heading out for this meeting."

Jessica smiled. "Well, why don't I tag along? It'll do me some good to be out in the field, and we can get some more of that face time you wanted on the way."

Lindsey was cornered. She knew the pitch well enough to deliver it herself, but to do it in front of Jessica?

"At least it's better than staying here," she thought, before smiling, pulling on Ted's suit jacket, and gesturing towards the door, telling Jessica, "Ladies first."

Jessica snickered. "And here I thought no gentlemen worked at this company," she said.

She passed Ted, who was frantically composing a text on her phone, presumably about the Bannister meeting. "Lindsey," she said, trying to sound casual, while looking for an excuse to get him out of the secretarial bullpen before anyone noticed him. "Jessica wants to come with me to Bannister. Why don't you hold down the fort from my office? There's some reorganization in there I need you to do in there. It should take you at least until we get back."

Ted looked like he was about to have a stroke as he considered the way this day kept evolving, but then he composed himself and said, "Yes, sir." He got up, pivoted on the heels of Jessica's boots, and walked into his own office. Lindsey couldn't help admiring the way his ass looked in her skirt, and Jessica caught her admiring it. Lindsey motioned like she was going to apologize, but Jessica simply laughed and held up a hand in a stop gesture.

"It's okay, Ted. We've all had attractive colleagues. The important part is that you don't act on that attraction, right?"

"Right!" Lindsey answered through clenched teeth, and marched towards the elevators.

"Would you mind driving?" Jessica asked on the way down to the garage. "After all those years at the London office, it's taking me a while to readjust to driving on the other side of the road."

Lindsey felt through her pockets until she found the keys to Ted's sports car. He had given her many rides in it, but never once let her drive. She was suddenly seeing a silver lining in this dark cloud.

"Sure thing, boss!" she said cheerfully.
142113111.title: Jessica nd Lindsey head off for an off site mee...

1421131111.content:
After an exhilarating highway drive where even Jessica approved of her pushing the sports car to its limits, Lindsey arrived at the hotel. She checked her reflection in the mirror. She hadn't thought of her hairstyle as masculine, nor had anyone ever accused her of looking androgynous, but between Ted's suit and the lack of makeup and jewelry, she looked close enough to pass. If she told people she was Ted Smith, then the illusion was believable.

The Bannister rep was named Kevin Jarvis, a balding, friendly Englishman much closer to Jessica's age than Lindsey's. He did, indeed, believe her as Ted — and it helped that she had been CC'ed on all their emails and been on the line for all their calls, so she could throw in details from past conversations. The pitch went even better than the small talk, to Lindsey's amazement. She had never done this in a meeting before, though she'd seen Ted do it plenty of times. As she strutted around the room, her hand cockily perched on the pocket of her borrowed trousers, she realized that she had always envied Ted his position, and that she not only liked doing his job for the moment, but was actually good at it.

She was, she would soon realize, *too* good at it.

"Well?" she asked with a confident smile as she finished.

There was a long pause at first, and for a moment, Lindsey worried she had messed up. But she turned to Jessica, who was practically beaming with pride, and when she turned back to Kevin, she could see that he was just searching for the right words to express his appreciation of the pitch.

"That," he said carefully but enthusiastically, "was maybe the best presentation of its type I've ever had the pleasure to witness in person. You've convinced me this would be an incredible opportunity for Bannister."

Lindsey felt herself flush with pride. For the moment, all memory of this swap of clothes, and roles, or the disaster that was approaching her and Ted whenever they were found out, was forgotten. She thought of putting on some false modesty, but knew that the real Ted wouldn't. And she had gotten this far by acting like Ted, so instead she confidently asked, "So, do we have a deal?"

He smiled and said, "We do, on one condition."

Her confidence faltered a bit. "What's that?"

"We would want you to come back with me to Bannister HQ in London so we can work together overseeing Phase 1 of the project."

Lindsey's heart began pounding again. She was not at all prepared for this, especially once she remembered that...

"Phase 1 is meant to last six months," she said, only barely remembering to maintain her fake male voice.

"At least!" Jessica interjected herself into the conversation, looking delighted with this turn of events. "Depending on how things go, you might get to be on the other side of the pond for a year, maybe two!"

"Maybe two?" Lindsey asked weakly, contemplating an extended time of having to dress like a man.

The other two seemed oblivious to her distress. "Ideally, you'd be able to fly back with me tonight," Kevin said. "I really want to get started on this immediately. We could set you and, say, your assistant up with housing for as long as you'd need, so you wouldn't have to worry about anything at all over there. Do you think you could swing such a fast turnaround?"

Before Lindsey could say anything, Jessica stepped in to say, "Of course he can. You're going to love London, Ted. Trust me. And I bet your lovely secretary — what was her name again?"

"Lindsey," she replied, feeling fainter by the minute.

"Yes," Jessica said, "Lindsey will adore getting to spend some extended time over there at such a young age. Why, maybe she'll meet and fall in love with an Englishman! Wouldn't that be just darling?"

Lindsey tried to imagine telling Ted about this latest turn of events. On the one hand, this was the (temporary) solution to all their problems. They'd be leaving immediately. They'd be an ocean away from anyone who knew them, and thus would have a long time before anyone caught on — maybe enough time to figure a way out of this catastrophe. On the other, they would be getting in so deep that there might never be a safe way out. What, she wondered, would Ted want to do?
1421131111.title: The meeting goes well

14211311112.content:
Lindsey again roared the sports car down the highway, this time heading back to the office with Jessica, feeling at once triumphant about how well she had done in the pitch and anxious about what to do regarding Kevin's request.

"I should say that I already feel as if I'm going to miss you terribly," Jessica said as they walked through the secretarial bullpen back towards Ted's office. "Even though we've only known each other for a few hours, I have a very good feeling about you, Mr. Ted Smith."

"Thanks," said Lindsey, again fighting the urge to blush. As bad as things were on some level, she couldn't resist the idea that she liked being treated like a powerful executive. And, as she strutted past some admiring (or, at least, puzzled) secretaries, she also couldn't help noticing how much more she enjoyed wearing Ted's fancy three-piece suit and oxfords than she did tottering around in her tight clothes and precarious heels.

They arrived at the office, where they found Ted seated on the couch, Jessica's boots lying on the floor near him as he rubbed what were clearly aching feet. He sat up with alarm when he saw them and began trying to spit out an apology, but Jessica tut-tutted him.

"Now now, young lady, that's quite alright," she told him. "I've been there many times myself, particularly when I'm vain enough to wear those boots. They look fabulous, but I always pay for it later." She sat down next to Ted, pulled off Lindsey's pumps, and began putting on and zipping up the boots. She gestured to the Louboutins, and added, "Though I have to admit these are precarious in their own way. But you're welcome to them back, and I appreciate the loan."

"That's okay," said an anxious Ted.

Lindsey could see it was killing him waiting to find out how the meeting had gone, and to have a moment alone with her so they could regroup and figure out what to do next. She decided to help him, by offering, "Thanks so much for helping me prep for the Bannister pitch, Lindsey. It went better than we could have possibly hoped for."

Ted seemed so stunned by this news that Lindsey felt a bit offended. Did he really think she couldn't do his job if she had to?

Before either could say anything else, Jessica interjected, "So well, in fact, that I believe the two of you need to have a big discussion now. I'll leave you to it. Ted, let me know what she decides immediately so travel can begin booking tickets for tonight."

"Tonight?" Ted asked, but Jessica had already twirled around on the heels of her boots and was marching out of the office. Ted turned to Lindsey, looking both scared and even a bit angry, and demanded to know what had happened. She told him everything, up to and including the offer for them both to transfer to London, immediately.

Ted looked thrilled, then shocked, then afraid again. He gestured at how they were each dressed. "But, we'd have to go... like this? For six months?"

"Maybe longer," Lindsey said, parroting Jessica. "If the project works, we might be there for a couple of years."

"YEARS?!?!?" Ted bellowed in his own voice, before realizing that people outside might be looking, and added much more quietly, "How did this go from a silly little sex game into something where we're posing as each other for years?!?"

Lindsey paced, again noticing how much easier this was to do in a man's suit. "I know, I know," she said, before laying out the bright side. "But it keeps us from being discovered right now. Nobody there knows us."

"Yes, but Kevin thinks you're me, which means I have to be you," he replied, not appeased. "I've been wearing a thong and fishnets for only a few hours and I already want to kill myself!"

"Calm down, girlie," said Lindsey, now more than a little annoyed to hear him moaning about the fashion challenges she had to put up with every day of her life. "At least it buys us time to think of a way out. Maybe once we're over there for a bit, there's a simple escape hatch. Like, you apply for another job virtually, take it, and we come back to America as ourselves, never once having to return to this place."

"That's not bad," he admitted.

"And the alternative is to swap our clothes back now, walk into Jessica's office, confess, and probably both become unemployable in this field," she added.

"That would be very bad," he said. He slipped the pumps back on, cringing a bit as he did so, stood up and walked around in them again. "I think you're right. We go to England, role play for a few weeks with me coaching you..."

"... and vice versa," she added, thinking of how woefully unqualified he was for most of her secretarial duties.

"Of course," he said apologetically. "And then once we're sure the project is on the right track, I start looking for a job back here — just preferably not *right* here — and we get to return to our own lives. It's the best of a bunch of bad options."

"I agree," she said, even as a part of her realized how much she was looking forward to getting to be Ted for as long as that phase of the plan lasted. Maybe, she thought, she might even find ways to extend that phase. "I guess we need to help each other pack?"

1421132122.content:
Ted sat stewing at his desk, trying to distract himself from their predicament by doing work, but he couldn't focus at all.

"How did I let you talk me in this?" he demanded of Lindsey.

Lindsey looked mortified. "I'm so, so sorry, boss man," she said. "What do you suppose Jessica is going to make us do?"

"I don't even want to think about that," he groaned, before realizing he should get a sense of what he was in for. He got up, cursing once again the discomfort of Lindsey's stilettos, and walked over to the door. He placed his ear against it, and could just barely make out the speech that Jessica was delivering to the assembled staff. It was something about the value of flexibility in the modern corporate world, and how important she found it for everyone to be able to do anyone else's job at a moment's notice.

"And," Jessica continued, "two of your colleagues have found a very dramatic and effective way to demonstrate this lesson." She raised her voice and called out, "Ted? Lindsey? It's time for your big reveal!"

Ted's heart felt like it wanted to explode out of his chest. "No way am I going out there now," he said half-heartedly.

Lindsey stood up, straightened her cuffs, and put a reassuring hand on his shoulder. "There's no way out of here except through that door, Ted. I don't think we have much choice in the matter."

"You're right," he admitted, and braced himself for the reaction that followed.

Lindsey pulled the door open and stepped out wearing his suit, then reached back to pull him out to follow her. They were greeted with a mix of gasps, giggles, and several approving comments from both male and female staffers. Ted tried not to blush, but it was a losing effort. He looked over at Lindsey, who only looked slightly less embarrassed.

"Don't they just look marvelous?" Jessica said, clearly reveling in their discomfort. "I was speaking with them both about this very subject, and it was Ted, I believe, who came up with this incredible idea. They will not only swap jobs for the next month, but clothes as well, as a symbol to the rest of the team about how interchangeable we must all be."

It was all Ted could do to keep from screaming. She wanted him to dress like this for a MONTH? And to do Lindsey's job that whole time? As bad as things had gotten, this seemed like a bridge too far. He pondered quitting then and there, career consequences be damned.

14211321222.content:
Ted realized he didn't have the guts to go through with it. He had built his whole career at this place, and what was he going to say when someone asked him why he abruptly quit? "I got caught wearing my secretary's clothes?" No, he realized with some discomfort, he was going to have to swallow his pride and tough it out for a month, and then hopefully life would get back to normal.

He smiled through gritted teeth, then told the amused crowd, "I know we look a bit ridiculous, but it's like Jessica said: we're a symbol of how we all need to be able to walk in each other's shoes if the job calls for it."

"Oh, I don't think you look ridiculous at all," called out Katrina Hope, an attractive blonde member of his team. "Why have you been hiding those legs in pants for all these years?"

There was more whooping and catcalling, and Ted found himself blushing again. Jessica was clearly enjoying his embarrassment, but she held up her arms to put a stop to the whistles and comments.

"Now now, this is still an office, and I still expect you to act like professionals," she told the group. "Let's all get back to work. In fact, I believe I have to go to receive some guests for a pitch meeting with Ted... or, I guess, Lindsey now." Amid more snickers, the crowd dispersed.

Ted's stomach lurched, as he remembered the reason he and Lindsey had been up all night in his office to begin with. He looked to Lindsey, who had an odd expression on her face — was she... pleased by this turn of events? — then to Jessica, who was smugger than ever.

"Fun and games and all of that," he said, "but you're not seriously going to send Lindsey to the pitch wearing my clothes, are you?"

Lindsey crossed her arms across her chest and pouted. "I've been working on this thing every step of the way with you, Ted. You don't think I can handle it?"

"Yes, Ted," Jessica added. "Or don't you believe in the very concept of this role swap that you proposed."

Ted felt like he was losing his mind. The clothes swap had been Lindsey's idea initially, and making it a team-building exercise had been Jessica's. And now both were acting like the whole thing had come from him? And he was just supposed to go along?

Lindsey checked her watch — it had been Ted's watch not long ago, he realized with some displeasure — and said, "We'd better get to the lobby. They should be here any minute."

"But," he said, desperately searching for a way out of this. "How are you expecting the clients to react to... this?"

"I think it will make for one of the more memorable pitches they've heard in quite some time, Ted," said Jessica. "Especially when they see how cute you look in that skirt."

Lindsey gestured towards the elevators, giggling as she said, "Come on, Ted. Ladies first."

"Well, enough's enough," he said. "I want you back up here right now, or else."

Cassidy thought about answering, "Or else what?" Instead, she studied her reflection in the bar mirror for a moment, enjoying the look of the suit far more than she had expected, before she said, "I think you should come down here instead."

There was a long silence before Ted replied, "Come down to the bar? But I don't have anything to wear!"

"Yes you do, silly," she told him with a giggle. "You have that little red dress I saw you looking so hot in before I left."

"Dressing like this in private is one thing," he said. "Being seen in it in public is another."

Cassidy checked Ted's expensive metal wristwatch. "Tell you what, sweet thing. You have 10 minutes from now to get your cute butt down here to have a drink with me, and maybe a LOT more fun after. Or I'm gone and you can figure out how to get home dressed like you are right now."

She clicked the disconnect button and returned to her drink. Part of her was very much hoping Ted would come down — not only so she could repair their relationship and make sure she had future gigs with him, but because she was getting surprisingly turned on by the whole role reversal. But part of her was also eager to just pick up his car and roar off into the night, consequences be damned.

It was another late night at work. Tim was working a late shift once again as was his secretary Lindsey. They were currently the only people still in the building and taking a small break in the break room a few floors down from their office.

"You sure you can work this late Lindsey?" Tim asked as he ate his meager meal.
"Yeah, you could use all the help you can get these days." Lindsey replied as she did the same.
"It's been kind of boring everywhere else anyway." Time laughed, trying to make light of the situation.
"Oh? How come?" Lindsey asked.
"Well, I have no real lover but even when I have to occasional interaction, it just starts to get stale." Tim complained.
"Have you tried role play?" Lindsey asked.
"I have but nothing really exciting has come up, it's just a bit too standard in most cases.
"It all depends on how you handle it." Lindsey giggled.
"That's true," Tim replied with a snicker.

"How much work do you have left anyway?" Lindsey asked.
"Just some paperwork for the most part, as boring as ever." Tim replied. "You?"
"Paperwork as well, I usually kind of enjoy it, but it's been kind of repetitive lately." Lindsey sighs.
"We should probably get back to it." Tim said bored as he got up.
"Yeah, but before we head back up, I think I know a way we can make it more interesting." Lindsey said.
"Do tell." Tim asked, curious what she had to say.
"What if we do some role play?" Lindsey suggested.
"How do you mean exactly?" Tim asked.
"Since there is no one around anyway, maybe we could try out a small little role swap?" Lindsey suggested with a smile.
"So we switch work places?" Tim asked, not knowing exactly what she meant.
"Work, clothes... names." Lindsey grinned.
"I'm not sure about this." Tim said hesitantly.
"No one is around and it would at least be a bit more exciting!" Lindsey said excited.
"Okay, in the elevator." Was all Tim said as they made their way over to the elevator.

Tim was currently wearing his usual black business suit with his smart shoes, it looked clean and was his favorite. Lindsey was wearing a black dress with some heels and looked as professional as she could without wearing a skirt suit.
Tim and Lindsey entered the elevator and as soon as the door closed, they started to undress. Tim took off his jacket and shirt first, then stripped off his shoes and pants and lastly dropped his boxers, moving as quickly as he could. Lindsey was very fast with taking off her dress and heels and unhooked her bra, then dropped her panties.

Tim then moved over to his secretary's pile of clothes and stepping into the black panties. They had a small red lace on the edges and were very tight on his crotch. He then hooked the bra on his chest, which he did fairly easily and lastly pulled the black dress over top his head and stepped into the heels. Lindsey in the meantime had gotten dressed in her boss's boxers, comfortable suit pants, shirt and jacket as well as his smart shoes.

As they just finished getting dressed, the elevator arrived at Tim’s office

14231.content:
Lindsey strutted off the elevator, looking completely at ease in Tim's clothes, her hands leaning out of his trouser pockets. Tim, on the other hand, was instantly struggling to get around in Lindsey's outfit. The little black dress was so tight that his legs could barely move, and the high heeled shoes made him feel like he was trying to stay balanced on a tightrope 100 feet above the ground.

"How do you walk in this stuff?" he groaned as he struggled to follow her into his office.

She swaggered around to his desk, plopped down in his chair, and boldly put her feet up, her hands folded smugly behind her head. She gave Tim a pitying look, and said, "Awww, the sacrifices we make for beauty." She appraised him up and down, then added, "But in your case, cutie, it's surely worth the pain."

Tim eased himself down onto the sofa where Lindsey usually sat when she worked away from her own desk. It felt good to not be standing, though the heels still pinched his feet something awful. "I think you got the better end of this deal," he grumbled.

Lindsey straightened her black necktie and fingered the lapel of her suit jacket. "I could pretend to find something to complain about," she admitted, "but I think you're right. I don't know that I'm ever going to trade back."

"Don't joke like that!" Tim snapped.

Lindsey pulled her feet off the desk, stood up, wandered over to sit next to Tim, and gently stroked his cheek. "Who said I was joking?"

"Yeah yeah yeah," Tim said. "Now what?"

She checked the sleek Rolex on her wrist, then announced, "Well, we do have to finish up each other's work, but there's something important I have to do first. Give me your purse, please."

Tim handed over the purse he still had on his shoulder, annoyed that she had referred to it as his, and watched as she fished through it until she produced a tube of lipstick, an eyeliner pencil, and a bottle of nail polish. Seeing where this was going, he raised his hands in protest.

"No, no no," he insisted. "I'll wear your clothes for a bit, but makeup is where I draw the line."

"But I want you to look like your prettiest self," she said with a pout. "And I think you'll feel happier in these clothes too if you can see how you look after I do my magic. Please?" She batted the lashes above her big blue eyes, and he was putty in her hands.

"Okay, fine," he grumbled. She clapped her hands with delight, then spent the next ten minutes carefully applying color (mostly red) to his lips, his cheeks, his eyes, and his finger and toenails. The latter at least allowed him to take off the cursed shoes, but now he had to wait even longer just to get back to work. Lindsey leaned back to take in the full look, pleased with her work. She fished a compact out of the purse, flipped open the mirror, and shocked Tim with his reflection. He certainly didn't look like a woman, but he did look...

"Gorgeous," he said, almost in a daze.

"You bet your sweet ass you are," Lindsey said, before getting up and going back to Tim's desk. She began going through the paperwork, warning him that he would have to do the same the second his nails were dry.

Within 15 minutes, he felt comfortable using his hands again, and he was pleasantly surprised to find that Lindsey had been right. Even though he was just doing more paperwork, the swap of role — and clothing — spiced it up enough that it was almost fun to complete. He blazed through it in record time. He was so focused on the task that, when he looked up again, he was shocked to realize that Lindsey had gone... taking his clothes, his phone, his wallet, and his car keys with her.

"Where the hell did she go?" he asked, starting to panic.
14231.title: Lindsey teases Tim

info.brief_description: Based on curious clothes exchange by mick
info.description:
This story is about our main character swapping clothes with another person because of various conditions.
Multiple main characters will be available and will be described in the character selection, feel free to suggest any additional characters.
Side characters can be added as you wish as long as their inclusion fits the character and story, some side characters (like girlfriends or family members) could be predetermined within descriptions as well.

Have fun with the story without many limitations, just the usual stuff like no unnecessary deaths or gore, keep it fun for everyone (above 18 at least).
Make sure you keep the swaps descriptive and interesting, sex is fine, but don't overuse it as it is not the main focus of the story.
As well as this, try to make sure the chapters stay interesting and different, chapter which contradict previous chapter will be deleted.

Try not to just start suggestions unless you write a chapter starting your story

If you want additional story options please feel free to ask and feel free to add
